info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:22PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN MASON, SOUTHERN KENTON, NORTHERN BRACKEN, CAMPBELL, NORTHERN PENDLETON, SOUTHERN CLERMONT AND SOUTHERN BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 622 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Independence to near Bethel, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Covington, Independence, Maysville, Alexandria, Taylor Mill, Georgetown, Walton, Claryville, Amelia, Bethel, New Richmond, Williamsburg, Ripley, Aberdeen, Batavia, Augusta, Felicity, Brooksville, Butler and Melbourne. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
